learning_objective: Create artifacts by using procedures within a program, combinations of data and procedures, or independent but interrelated programs.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Phoenix is creating an interactive learning program for their history classmates to identify key figures from the Renaissance and Enlightenment periods. The code looks as follows:This code works, but if Phoenix wants to add a new historical figure to the program, they must modify this code. How can Phoenix make it easier to add new historical figures to the program?",
    "Answer1": "By converting the program to a different programming language",
    "Answer2": "By creating a separate procedure for each historical figure",
    "Answer3": "By creating a class for historical figures, with attribute fields for name, period, and spark of the figure. This class also has a method to return the formatted text",
    "Answer4": "By creating a separate file for each historical figure",
    "CorrectAnswer": "3",
    "Explanation": "Phoenix can make the program more flexible by creating a historical figure class. Each time Phoenix wants to add a new figure, they just need to create a new object, input this information, and the method will automatically return the formatted information for this figure.",
    "code_snippet": "text renaissanceFigures = \"Leonardo da Vinci - Renaissance\\nGalileo Galilei - Renaissance\"\ntext enlightenmentFigures = \"Isaac Newton - Enlightenment\\nJohn Locke - Enlightenment\"\noutput renaissanceFigures + \"\\n\" + enlightenmentFigures"
}
